docs.lead_paragraph: What does pregnancy do to a real woman's body. We've all seen (and discussed) the airbrushed, surgically enhanced, personal-trainer-burnished versions that celebrities show us in magazines. But what about the rest of us?
docs.abstract: A parenting site is asking readers to send photos of their breasts after pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: 8 P.M. (ESPN) THE 16TH MAN In 1995, just a year after the overthrow of apartheid and as the new government of Nelson Mandela was seeking to rebuild the nation, South Africa hosted the Rugby World Cup. Despite having only one nonwhite player, the South African Springboks gained the support of the country and, bucking heavy odds, beat the New Zealand All Blacks. Afterward, Mr. Mandela, far left, wearing a Springboks jersey, walked to the center of the pitch and shook hands with the team's captain, François Pienaar, above right -- a gesture seen as a step toward healing a deeply divided nation. Morgan Freeman, who played Mr. Mandela in the 2009 feature ''Invictus,'' produced this film, directed by Clifford Bestall, as part of ESPN's ''30 for 30'' anniversary programming. 10 A.M. (ABC) RACHAEL RAY Rosie O'Donnell takes audience questions.

docs.lead_paragraph: Katie Allison Granju wrote a book, some say the book, about attachment parenting. She writes a popular blog, mamapundit.com, about the ups and downs of her blended family of four children, who range in age from 3 to 18, with a baby girl due this summer. As she puts it, "I've blogged through marriage, the end of a marriage, a horrifically painful divorce, re-entry into the full-time work force, single parenting, working motherhood, falling in love, remarriage, blended family life, pregnancy, miscarriage, childbirth, breast-feeding, baby- and toddlerhood."
docs.abstract: A mother and blogger opens up about her son's drug addiction.
docs.snippet: A mother and blogger opens up about her son's drug addiction.
